title: Imaqtpie Got Honor 2 after 1 Month, I was honor 1 for 1 season
body:
YIKES
Imaqtpie was chat banned on stream (i was watching live) about 1.2 month ago, and he got his honor2 back about 2-3 days ago (i was watching live ).
and again YIKES , I was honor 0 for whole of one season, and now im still honor 0 , maybe that is just because im not streamer ? and because he is streamer he can play clash and have his honor ?
can't we have a super honor level boost and we have to wait all season for one honor ?

replies.body:
How much games do you play a day? Hard to get honored if you dont play. 

QT plays 107503 games a day. Like every day lol
i just play all the day lol

> [{quoted}](name=amirreza2142,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=jJdBctTZ,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2018-06-10T09:05:25.157+0000)
>
> i just play all the day lol

I could be wrong, but it appear that you are level 38. While QT is level level 163. I'm going to have to say he plays a bit more than you
 
or you got permabanned/this is a smurf? lol

Level 71 , Honor 1
Level 100 , Honor 2 [29]
--
Level 160 Honor 1
Level 163 Honor 2 [3]
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
Looking at your match history it's clear that while you play alot, you don't play anywhere nearly as much as imaqtpie.
i play dozens of games all day and still honor level 0 despite almost always having at least one honor after every game but hey at least im 1 out or 3 levels from being honor 1 i guess.

First - he probably stopped being toxic - no guarantee that you did.

Second, and far more importantly - he probably plays more games in a day than you play in a month. So his 5 weeks of playing is probably closer to 3 years of you playing, than it is to 1 year of you playing even... 

Finally - because he's famous he probably got a lot of extra honors he didn't deserve / otherwise wouldn't have gotten. There were probably a decent number of challenger people who knew he had been chat banned and gave him honor to help him get back to honor 2 when they would have otherwise sent it elsewhere. At that level of play, a lot of the players know eachother pretty well.

Actually bring honored doesnt accelerate it.

Honoring does.

> [{quoted}](name=Terozu,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=jJdBctTZ,comment-id=000f0000,timestamp=2018-06-10T15:42:32.791+0000)
>
> Actually bring honored doesnt accelerate it.
> 
> Honoring does.

Seriously? Do you have a link for that?

Honoring no doubt accelerates it, because when everyone honors someone on your team, everyone gets a little extra honor. I'm surprised that getting honor wouldn't accelerate it though. Never heard that before.
It would, but valid reports would also slow it down. Being neutral (or not talking) progresses nore slowly than positive communication.
I'm not a streamer and I got honor 2 in less a month. lul

Just because you didnt receive other punishments doesnt mean you are honorable to get it back up. I can guarantee you still type shit but not enough to be suspended, if someone reports you for it, system automatically stops your honor progress. If you actually want to get your honor back, being honored by someone is not enough, you have to have a clean sheet.
P.S my friend is going through the same thing, plays few games everyday, gets honored but it aint increasing. Why? Because he still rages at others in chat.

It is unrelated to whether or not you stream. 

It is based off your current behavior and the severity of your prior punishment. 

You will progress as long as you are being neutral or positive. Even if you don’t chat in game, you will progress.
100% FAke , i played a lot of games s7 and my honor never leveled up , just because he is streamer , they give him honor2 back to play clash beta cup , FAIR

> [{quoted}](name=perspolis1,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=jJdBctTZ,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2018-06-10T09:08:25.929+0000)
>
> 100% FAke , i played a lot of games s7 and my honor never leveled up , just because he is streamer , they give him honor2 back to play clash beta cup , FAIR

Why would you assume that riot did anything? 
 
It's obvious that he plays more than everyone on this post combined. And players probably honor him because he's QT lol.

Same as why Riot unbanned Tyler1. It's because they got tired of ban? No, they unbanned him so that more people ''can'' return to the league. They knew they gonna need some way to get more people back.. Eh... I'm pretty sure they look at all popular streamers and try to box them in.

He was un-ID ban.

Standard procedure is about a years length, then they get to retry.
There is a huge difference between an ID ban and perma bans, much less chat restrictions. All of T1's banned accounts are still banned.

> [{quoted}](name=Periscope,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=jJdBctTZ,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2018-06-10T09:05:48.568+0000)
>
> It is unrelated to whether or not you stream. 
> 
> It is based off your current behavior and the severity of your prior punishment. 
> 
> You will progress as long as you are being neutral or positive. Even if you don’t chat in game, you will progress.

Wrong
They don’t create systems that treat others differently.

> [{quoted}](name=Periscope,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=jJdBctTZ,comment-id=000100010000,timestamp=2018-06-10T16:17:51.312+0000)
>
> They don’t create systems that treat others differently.

yes they do

Why do you think that is, or what evidence do you have that there's a different precedent for certain players? Because that difference goes against everything I've read about the punishment system and the honor system.

> [{quoted}](name=Periscope,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=jJdBctTZ,comment-id=00010001000000000000,timestamp=2018-06-11T13:54:18.664+0000)
>
> Why do you think that is, or what evidence do you have that there's a different precedent for certain players? Because that difference goes against everything I've read about the punishment system and the honor system.

I think it based on observation, what is your proof that they don't. Them saying they don't isn't proof, a murderer or any other criminal doesn't say they do it either.

> [{quoted}](name=5Percenter,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=jJdBctTZ,comment-id=000100010000000000000000,timestamp=2018-06-11T16:07:14.014+0000)
>
> I think it based on observation, what is your proof that they don't. Them saying they don't isn't proof, a murderer or any other criminal doesn't say they do it either.

[This](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/ebWsBPQs-trolling-banable?comment=000400020000) is probably the best that I've got, that other VIPs (such as pro players) are not held to different standards. If anything, they should be held to higher standards, as exemplified in ID bans, which have been given to popular streamers and pro-players. 

No, I don't have any information that states that honor gain is different for streamers, pro-players, or anyone else. However, that seems like it would be highly controversial if they made it easier for others to gain honor or easier for others to not get punished; such a policy would lead to resentment and players leaving the game. That's just my opinion though.
I noticed you have a week break between games at times. Don't need to lie about playing everyday when you don't. Playing for the last 5 days doesn't count as everyday.

Well it depends on how many times you get honored. Streamer "celebrities" get constantly honored just for being in the same game as them.

It's how the world works. Sucks but that's how it is.

There are three main reasons why:

1. Streamers play a TON of League of Legends. It's literally their job. So they probably play more than you.
2. People recognize streamers, and there are always those suck-ups that honor them.
3. Excepting Tyler1 and a few others, most streamers know that they're on thin ice of losing their job when they get punished and don't say anything remotely toxic until they think they're safe again.

That's probably why he's getting honor so quickly. I seriously doubt that Riot is giving streamers a free honor level-up.
How many games a day do you play? Plus, last season the honor system was much less rewarding.

I got honor 2 back in less than 2 months.

Honor 0 lasted a single week.

1st question. 

Do you play 15 games a day for 6 or 7 days like he does?

Are you getting validly reported in your games? Alot of people in high ELO are known for not reporting each other. 

Then there are the standard stuff of getting Honors and getting team honor bonus.

So if you have the same parameters as QTPie, you really can't compare you to him.
NORMAL PEOPLE CANT LEVEL UP THEIR HONOR , DIDNT GET IT ?
Im a  normal person ... and i can level up my honor {{sticker:sg-soraka}}
they love to ban u , so u buy skins again $$$

Everyone knows him.
Everyone honor him.

Morever he never toxic

> [{quoted}](name=Shukr4n,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=jJdBctTZ,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2018-06-10T09:28:09.513+0000)
> Morever he never toxic

And yet he was chat banned. But he's not toxic?

Bruh.

He's toxic, most leage streamers are.

> [{quoted}](name=Annie x Zoe Yuri,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=jJdBctTZ,comment-id=00050000,timestamp=2018-06-10T10:14:37.611+0000)
>most leage streamers are.

nice generalization, you must only follow tyler and hashinshin if you think they represent most people who stream league

But he got his honor back faster.
Every human being can do mistakes. Then the usuall behaviour comes and make different results.
Like others can make 20accounts permabanned, he could revert the chat restriction.

Its because you were still being toxic most likely. Even if youre not toxic enough to punish it slows honor gen.

Also keep in mind QT probs spends many more hours playing than you do.

wow the amounts of up and downvotes on this thread.
clearly showing the split community opinion/knowledge
the downvotes are mostly people who have a hard time regaining their honor tbh

before you guys just impulse upvote this thread, just know that you regain honor by playing. qtpie plays for a LIVING, so think about how many games he's sat down and played, compared to average players like us.

YIKES
you can't climb honor because you're not a positive member of the rift
YIKES
thats false but keep dreaming

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jJRxQlAirsY

9:00
Im toxic af and im almost h4... Do things that impress people and they will honor you :/

The reason why he got back to honor 2 is most likely that he isn't toxic in game anymore. (I wasn't aware he was even punished). Being a streamer has nothing to do with that. If you want to regain your honor (and not get punished) you might want to stop being negative since negativity results in being validly reported, and that will slow down or even stop your honor progress even if you don't get punished. If you do get punished, well, it is back to honor 0 and I guess you might get a Permanent Suspension the next time.

Who doesn't know Imaqtpie? He is honored every game whether he feeds or flames because he is a celebrity. So you not being honored means, because of the current state of the game, that you aren't single handily carrying the game.
